info.name: Keyblade Wielder
info.description: The Keyblade Wielder class created for a Kingdom Hearts inspired campaign.
info.author: AntiAlex

description.p: Keyblade Wielders are chosen by their Keyblades for their strong hearts.
A Keyblade Wielder is trained to protect Kingdom Hearts. This is done primarily by using the Keyblade, a powerful weapon with a heart of it's own.
First, you should pick Strength followed by either Constitution or Wisdom depending on how you would like to play your character.
As a Keyblade Wielder you gain the following class features.

Hit Dice:1d6 per Keyblade Wielder level
Hit Points at 1st Level:6 + Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels:1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per Keyblade Wielder level after 1st

Saving Throws:Strength
Skills:Choose two from Acrobatics, Athletics, History, Medicine, Nature, Perception, and Religion
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a leather armor or (b) padded armor
(a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

sheet.description: A spellcaster who draws on inherent magic from a gift or training.

setters.set: A spellcaster who draws on inherent magic from a gift or training.

description.p: You've trained since a young age to not only master a Keyblade but to use magic to aid you in your adventures.
Is this needed? Could be used for abilities? Sonic Blade, Ragnarok etc.

The table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell Fire and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast Fire using either slot.
description.h5: SPELLS KNOWN OF 1ST LEVEL AND HIGHER
description.p: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the Keyspells spell list.
The Spells Known column of the Keyspells table shows when you learn more Keyspells spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Keyspells you know and replace it with another spell from the Keyspells spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Keyspells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Keyspell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
A Keyblade, or any weapon enhanced with a Keychain, can be used as a spellcasting focus for all kinds of spells.

sheet.description: You have the ability to cast spells.

description.p: Choose a path, which describes the source of your heart: Light or Dark, both detailed at the end of the class description.
Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 1st level and again at 6th, 14th, and 18th level.
At 3rd level, you tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself. This wellspring is represented by recharge points, which allow you to trigger a magical recharge.

You have 2 recharge points, and you gain more as you reach higher levels, as shown in the Recharge Points column of the Recharge table. You can never have more recharge points than shown on the table for your level. Using a recharge point takes one of your actions in your turn. You regain all spent recharge points when you finish a long rest.
At 5th level, you gain an additional attack per turn. You gain another one at 10th and 15th level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
At 20th level, you gain your best ability which can only be used once per long rest.

sheet.description: Heart's release deals damage in a circular area, range of 20ft centred on the user. Damage dealt is determined by rolling a d20 + Charisma modifier.

description.p: Your have rejected the teachings of your former masters in favour of teachings that make more sense to you.

sheet.description: Training in this path provides abilities to help anyone on their journey. From embracing your inner element to providing a faster form of travel.

description.p: Starting at 1st level. You gain the ability to craft your own Keychains, these Keychains serve to alter the appearance and effectiveness of any weapon it is attached to as well as providing proficiency in the weapon. Each Keychain takes a full day to create and if you wish to attach it to a weapon that isn't already modified for that purpose that will take an additional day.

sheet.description: Can craft Keychains. The base cost is 1 day plus any relevant materials. Creating a 'socket' on a weapon costs 1 day plus 1000 Munny or 100 Gold

description.p: At 1st level, you choose one type of element which can be used in any attacks with your weapon as well as providing an elemental effect for your Heart Manifestation.

sheet.description: For any attack with a weapon roll an additional 1d4 for elemental damage, does not override elements already on a weapon. When using your Heart Manifestation roll a 1d4, this damage applies to all creatures that get damaged by Heart Manifestation.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you may try to influence the darkness in people's hearts to encourage them to abandon the light. Prominent figures may turn into unique Heartless while the vast majority of the population will turn into more common Heartless. Also allows you to summon Shadows to your side outside of battle.

sheet.description: Summon Shadows outside of battle or darken someone's heart.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you master the ability to create and travel through your own Dark Corridors to places you have already been or to your master. This form of travel is instant.

sheet.description: Create a corridor to your master or somewhere you've been before.

description.p: At 18th level you gain your last ability, this ability can be used once per battle. A shadow arm sprouts from one of your arms, up to 10ft in length and wraps around your enemy causing 1d20 damage, plus 1d10 damage if you choose to use your embraced element.

sheet.description: A shadow arm grabs an enemy causing 1d20 damage, plus an additional 1d10 Elemental Embrace damage. Uses 2 actions.

description.p: You have trained for years to become a Keyblade master but your final test lies in how you apply your master's teachings in the outside world.

sheet.description: Training in this path provides abilities to help anyone on their journey. From freeing those you come across to adaptability in battles.

description.p: Starting at 1st level. You gain the ability to craft your own Keychains, these Keychains serve to alter the appearance and effectiveness of any weapon it is attached to as well as providing proficiency in the weapon. Each Keychain takes a full day to create and if you wish to attach it to a weapon that isn't already modified for that purpose that will take an additional day.

sheet.description: Can craft Keychains. The base cost is 1 day plus any relevant materials. Creating a 'socket' on a weapon costs 1 day plus 1000 Munny or 100 Gold

description.p: At 1st level, you are able to calm and sooth a person's heart, restoring it's light.

sheet.description: Roll 1d20 to attempt to calm a negative emotion and restore a heart. If used in battle it uses 1 action.

description.p: During your travels you may have already helped a lot of people, some of these may offer to help you on your travels. Changing your line up takes one day for them to travel to you, unless you are in Mickey's or Yensid's tower in which case they will meet you at your next destination. If you are in somebody's world and wish them to join you then they will join instantly and the person leaving your lineup will return to their homeworld.

sheet.description: You may be accompanied by 2 companions, each change of line up takes 1 day unless stated otherwise.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you will have met many magical entities that have pledged you help. These entities will hand over a charm that can be used to summon them and they will last for 2 turns. Only 1 summoning can happen per battle. Uses 1 action.

sheet.description: Use an action to summon a temporary helper.

description.p: At 18th level you gain your last ability, this ability can be used once per battle and uses 1 action but lasts the rest of the battle. Your training has advanced further during your adventues and you've gained the ability to change your fighting style to suit situations that require a less broad approach. This may be dismisssed for 1 action.

sheet.description: Can be used once per battle and uses 1 action but lasts the entire battle unless dismissed which also uses 1 action.
